question:
You paid a refundable deposit when you rented an apartment. You left the apartment in good condition but the Landlord won't return your deposit.Write a letter to the landlord. In your letter
explain why you are writingask for the return of your depositinform the landlord of possible legal action
text: Well,  I am writing to draw your attention to the subject matter of an initial deposit that was $2000 at the time of renting an apartment and signing a contract and it was clearly mentioned in a clause that rent is refundable. in this regard I am requesting numerous times verbally to refund it, therefore, I decided to write a letter to you as proof evidence as the last resort and I am still requesting to refund my security because I need the money to rent out another apartment nearby my college area.

Furthermore, I left your apartment in a neat and clean condition without damaging your property, as well as according to a lease deed or written contract I am entitled to a refund at the time of leaving your premises.

lastly, I would like to warn you that within a week if you would not pay back my initial deposit I would like to present a petition to the honourable court with all evidence such as the rent deed and photocopy of the initial security cheque and then the court will decide your punishment.
I am looking forward to your immediate response to this letter within a week of letter arrival.
